{{< include macros.qmd >}}

:::{#exr-ci-OR}
Given
a maximum likelihood estimate $\hb$
and
a corresponding estimated covariance matrix 
$\hS \eqdef \hat{\Covt}(\hb)$, 
calculate a 95% confidence interval for the odds ratio 
comparing covariate patterns $\vx$ and $\vxs$, $\ror(\vx,\vxs)$.
:::

---

:::{#sol-ci-OR}

::: notes
By @thm-dist-mle,
a 95% confidence interval for $\ror(\vx,\vxs)$
can be constructed as:

$$\hat\ror \pm 1.96 * \HSE{\hat\ror}$$
However, $\HSE{\hat\ror}$ will be difficult to compute directly;
it would require using the [delta method](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delta_method).

Instead, using the invariance property of MLEs,
we can first calculate a confidence interval for the log of the odds ratio,
$\logf{\ror(\vx,\vxs)} \in (L,R)$,
and then exponentiate the endpoints of that log-odds-scale confidence interval:
:::

$$\ror(\vx,\vxs) \in (e^L, e^R)$$

:::

---

:::{#exr-or-diff-logodds}

Find a 95% confidence interval for the log of the odds ratio,
$\logf{\ror(\vx,\vxs)}$

:::

---

:::{#sol-or-diff-logodds}

From @cor-log-or, we know:

$$\logf{\ror(\vx,\vxs)} = \difflogodds$$

By @thm-dist-mle and MLE invariance,
a 95% confidence interval for $\difflogodds$
can be constructed as:

$$\Delta{\hat\logodds} \pm 1.96 * \HSE{\Delta{\logodds}}$$

:::

---

:::{#exr-se-diff-logodds}

::: notes
Find an expression for the standard error of
$\Delta{\hat\logodds} \eqdef \hat{\logodds}(\vx) - \hat{\logodds}(\vxs)$
in terms of $\hb$ and $\Sigma \eqdef \Covt(\hb)$ (the variance-covariance matrix of $\hb$) .
:::

$$\HSE{\Delta{\hat\logodds}} = ?$$

:::

---

:::{#sol-se-diff-logodds}

$$\SE{\Delta \hat \logodds} = \sqrt{\Var{\Delta \hat \logodds}}$$

By @lem-diff-logodds and @thm-var-lincom:

$$
\ba
\Var{\Delta \hat \logodds}
&=
\Var{(\diffvx) \cdot \hb}
\\
&= \Var{(\diffvx) \cdot \hb}
\\
&= \tp{\diffvx}\Var{\hb}(\diffvx)
\\
&= \tp{\diffvx}\Sigma(\diffvx)
\\
&= \sumip\sumjp (\diffvx)_i \Sigma_{ij} (\diffvx)_j
\\
&= \sumip\sumjp (\Delta x_i) \Sigma_{ij} (\Delta x_j)
\\
&= \sumip\sumjp (x_i - x^*_i) \Covt(\hb_i,\hb_j) (x_j - x^*_j)
\ea
$$

Therefore, by MLE invariance:

$$\Delta{\hat\logodds} = \tp{\diffvx}\hat{\Sigma}(\diffvx)$$


::: notes
Compare with @sec-se-fitted.

:::

:::
